Description: Limestone stela: roughly-shaped limestone stela with a rounded top, broken at the base. The stela bears an inscription giving the name Itika with titles. The signs are carved in low relief by lowering the surface immediately around the hieroglyphs, but this cutting was not continued over the whole of the face of the stela. Good condition.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' I, 27, pl.XXXI, 40; pl.XXXVI, 40; British Museum, 'Hieroglyphic Texts from Egyptian Stelae, etc'., I (London), pl.1; P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit I (Wiesbaden, 1963), 183, 439.
